item.title: Gears of War: Reloaded multiplayer beta weekends set for June 13 to 15, June 20 to 22
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/gears-of-war-reloaded-multiplayer-beta-weekends-set-for-june-13-to-15-june-20-to-22

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Details and how to gain access.

Publisher Xbox Game Studios and developers The Coalition, Sumo Digital, and Disbelief will host multiplayer beta test weekends for Gears of War: Reloaded from June 13 to 15 and June 20 to 22, the companies announced.

To gain access, players must either pre-order Gears of War: Reloaded, have an active Game Pass Ultimate or PC Game Pass membership, or own a digital copy of Gears of War: Ultimate Edition.

Here are the details:

Multiplayer Beta Weekend 1 runs June 13 to 15 and features a social multiplayer experience in the classic Team Deathmatch mode across three maps including the fan-favorite Gridlock, as well as Raven Down and Gold Rush.

  • Starts: Friday, June 13 at 7:00 p.m. UTC (12:00 p.m. PST)
  • Ends: Sunday, June 15 at 7:00 p.m. UTC (12:00 p.m. PST)

Multiplayer Beta Weekend 2 runs June 20 to 22 and adds the competitive King of the Hill mode on the map Canals being added to the mix, along with the maps Courtyard and War Machine for use in Team Deathmatch.

  • Starts: Friday, June 20 at 7:00 p.m. UTC (12:00 p.m. PST)
  • Ends: Sunday, June 22 at 7:00 p.m. UTC (12:00 p.m. PST)

Gears of War: Reloaded is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on August 26.

item.title: poncle and Nao Games announce keyboard-smashing hack-and-slash game Berserk or Die for PC, now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/poncle-and-nao-games-announce-keyboard-smashing-hack-and-slash-game-berserk-or-die-for-pc-now-available

  • PC

From the developer behind Ninja or Die: Shadow of the Sun.

Publisher poncle and Ninja or Die: Shadow of the Sun developer Nao Gmaes have announced Berserk or Die, a side-scrolling action game with a unique keyboard-smashing control scheme. It is available now for PC via Steam for $3.99 / £2.99 / €3.99.

“I created this game with the goal of making something completely new,” said Nao Games founder Nao Shibata in a press release. “I believe it offers an experience that no other game can provide. Not only have I been able to bring my unique ideas to life, but I’ve also had the pleasure of meeting some amazing people along the way.”

poncle founder Luca Galante added, “NaoGames shares the poncle spirit of making games that are immediately accessible, affordable, and a bit out of the ordinary; for fun. When I first met Shibata-san and played Berserk or Die, I knew this was a game that deserved to be seen and played by more people. I’m really happy we got to support Shibata-san and hopefully make that happen.”

Here is an overview of the game, via poncle:

About

In Berserk or Die, players take on the role of a lone soldier left standing on a ravaged battlefield, fending off the hordes of enemies swarming from left and right. To survive, players must buy from peddlers, hit the training grounds, and mash as many keys on their keyboard as possible without voiding their warranty. Movement in each stage is controlled entirely by attacks, so players don’t need to reach a specific destination, just survive the onslaught. The more keys you press, the more devastating your attacks will become – and if keyboards aren’t for you, controllers work just as well, plus further accessibility options.

But really, Berserk or Die is all about the satisfaction of landing a perfectly-timed hit and watching foes fly across the screen in a flurry of pixels time and time again.

Key Features

  • Fight against hordes of enemies as the last soldier standing on battlefields from both history and fantasy.
  • Strike your keyboard left and right to attack; the more keys you strike, the wilder and more powerful your moves.
  • The keyboard is used not just as a controller, but as an extension of the player’s movements, allowing them to face off against multiple enemies with their own hands.
  • Once your special gauge is full, shake your mouse to use your special move and wipe through the enemies on screen in one dramatic move.
  • Browse the wares of peddlers at nightfall, buying magical items to heal and power up.
  • Visit the training grounds to learn powerful new skills that transform you into a force to be reckoned with.
  • Experience all of the action in a unique pixel art style synonymous with the game’s creator, Nao Shibata.
  • Original soundtrack by Vampire Survivors composer, Filippo Vicarelli.
  • Accessibility options available for controls, in addition to the main keyboard and mouse setup.

item.title: Free-to-play open-world creature catching action RPG Aniimo announced for Xbox Series, PC, iOS, and Android
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/free-to-play-open-world-creature-catching-action-rpg-aniimo-announced-for-xbox-series-pc-ios-and-android

  • PC
  • Smartphone
  • Xbox Series

PC closed beta test set for summer.

Kingsglory, a new publishing label of FunPlus, and developer Pawprint Studio have announced free-to-play open-world creature catching action RPG Aniimo for Xbox Series, PC (Microsoft Store), iOS, and Android. It will launch in 2026. Sign-ups for a PC closed beta test, which will run this summer, are available now via the game’s official website.

“Like every other player, the Aniimo team has always believed that one day, there will be a game that exists that makes all our dreams come true,” said Pawprint Studio executive producer Jovi Zhang in a press release. “Instead of waiting any longer, we created it ourselves. Every day we are discovering more about the Aniimo’s personalities, their interactions, their stories and their environment. The world of Aniimo is now ready for you to explore with us, and we can’t wait to see you there!”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Kingsglory:

About

Aniimo is a free-to-play, creature-catching open-world action RPG.

Players of Aniimo will enjoy a groundbreaking game where players collect and merge with magical creatures called Aniimo (through the unique “Twining” mechanic) to explore uncharted landscapes, solve ancient mysteries, and master dynamic gameplay in a journey of discovery.

Key Features

  • Discovery of the Aniimo, beautifully rendered magical creatures which players can seek, capture, battle, upgrade, develop, research and evolve as they progress through the game.
  • The interactive and expansive open world of Idyll inhabited by the Aniimo, providing multiple options for Aniimo to grow and evolve, and the perfect stage for them to shine.
  • The merging of players and their Aniimo, known as Twining, whereby players will unlock more abilities, different perspectives, and new and unique ways to play.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Paralives launches in Early Access on December 8
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/paralives-launches-in-early-access-on-december-8

  • PC

Life simulation game dated.

Life simulation video game Paralives will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on December 8, developer Paralives Studio announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Paralives is a doll house life simulation indie game for PC and Mac. Build your dream house, create some characters and manage their lives the way you want inside their homes and all around an open world town!

Key Features

  • Build – Dreaming of building your perfect house but need the right tools? No problem! Paralives comes with innovative tools to create grid-less constructions, curved walls, resizable objects, split level floors, custom shaped stairs, full color/texture customization and much, much more!
  • Create – What about creating a unique Parafolk? Paralives comes with an advanced character creator including a height slider, resizable facial and body features, full color customization and complex personalities. From head to toe, you can really decide it all!
  • Live – Willing to immerse yourself in parallel lives and achieve your wildest dreams? We’ve got your back! Take care of your pet, focus on your career, find true love, spend time with friends and family, explore hobbies or be as mischievous as ever.
  • Discover – Looking to discover an open world filled with opportunities and venues? Summer or winter, there’s always something to do. Put on your best outfit, call some friends and use your bike or car to meet them at the park, restaurant, beach, shop, mountain or anywhere, really!
  • Made with the Community, For the Community – What about user created content and mods? Paralives is made by lovers of simulation games with the support of the community to make it the best it can be. Use the Steam Workshop to download user created mods, houses, characters and much more!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Spirit X Strike launches in Early Access on June 20
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/spirit-x-strike-launches-in-early-access-on-june-20

High-speed action adventure game Spirit X Strke will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on June 20 for $12.99, developer MAICHA announced. It will be available at a 10 percent-off launch discount for two weeks. Language support include English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, French, and Portuguese, with more localizations planned as the game develops.

Here is an overview of the game, via MAICHA:

Set in a gritty, post-apocalyptic world inspired by classic anime like Fist of the North Star, Spirit X Strike invites players into a universe where style is just as important as strength. Join Carter on his journey to find his missing Master, utilizing his Spirit Strike Martial Art skills in the stylish wasteland. With razor-sharp responsiveness and explosive visual flair, the game delivers a combat experience as intense as it is expressive.

At launch, the Early Access version will feature six stages and six boss battles. These levels are packed with enemy variety, unique terrains, and escalating challenges that reward aggressive experimentation and replayability.

Players can test their skills across four carefully balanced difficulty modes, making the game accessible to newcomers while offering a fierce challenge to action game veterans. The highest difficulty level can only be unlocked after beating the game, which will feature entirely new and more unforgiving enemy combinations that will constantly test players to adapt and choose their priority.

A standout feature of Spirit X Strike is its three distinct combat styles, which players can switch between at any moment. Each style introduces a different tempo, technique, and combo potential, encouraging experimentation and strategic adaptation mid-fight.

The Early Access release is just the beginning. The team is committed to frequent content updates, community-driven feedback loops, and ongoing polish as Spirit X Strike evolves toward full release.

item.title: Microsoft and Double Fine Productions announce puzzle adventure game Keeper for Xbox Series, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/microsoft-and-double-fine-productions-announce-puzzle-adventure-game-keeper-for-xbox-series-pc

Publisher Xbox Game Studios and developer Double Fine Productions have announced Keeper, a third-person puzzle adventure game featuring a story told without words. It will launch for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on October 17. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via Microsoft:

About

From Lee Petty and Double Fine Productions, creators of Stacking, Headlander, RAD, and Psychonauts, Keeper is a beautiful and surreal third-person, atmospheric, puzzle adventure, and a story told without words.

On an island in a long-lost sea, a forgotten lighthouse stands dormant in the shadow of a distant mountain peak. As withering tendrils spread and coalesce, it awakens. Taken with a mysterious sense of purpose and joined by a spirited seabird, it embarks upon a heartening tale of unlikely companionship, an odyssey of mystifying metamorphosis, and an unexpected journey towards the center of the island, into realms beyond understanding.

Key Features

  • A story told without words.
  • A heartening tale of unlikely companionship.
  • An unexpected Journey into realms beyond understanding.
  • A beautiful otherworldly adventure.
  • An odyssey of mystifying metamorphosis.

item.title: Super Meat Boy 3D announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/super-meat-boy-3d-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

Team meat has announced Super Meat Boy 3D for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC (Steam, Epic Games Store, Microsoft Store). It will launch in early 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Team Meat:

About

Super Meat Boy 3D is a tough as nails platformer where you play as an animated cube of meat who’s trying to save his girlfriend (who happens to be made of bandages) from an evil fetus in a jar wearing a tux—IN 3D! Our meaty hero will leap from walls, over seas of buzz saws, through crumbling caves and pools of old trash sacrificing his own well-being to save his damsel in distress—IN 3D. Super Meat Boy 3D brings the old school difficulty of classic retro titles we all know and love and streamlines them down to the essential no bull straight forward twitch reflex platforming. Ramping up in difficulty from hard to soul crushing Meat Boy will brave lush (but also on fire) forests, vast dumps filled with the waste of mankind, and high-tech forges producing the very traps that will inevitably kill Meat Boy over and over and over—IN 3D! And if a bunch of levels weren’t enough, we also have epic boss fights and tons of unlockable secrets—IN 3D!

Key Features

  • Tough-as-nails precision platforming action
  • Brutal, but fair levels designed to break you.
  • Boss. Fights.
  • Dark World levels so tough, you’ll scream in the rain at a bus stop.
  • A soundtrack that was once described by a Guitar Center employee as “hey, either buy the guitars or get out. We’re seriously going to call the cops.”
  • 3D.
